text: IMAGE: FLICKERING FIRELIGHT. The NOLDORIN FORGE in EREGIO MOLTEN GOLD POURS from the lip of an IRON LADLE.
It began with the forging of the Great Rings. IMAGE: THREE RINGS, each set with a single GEM, are recei by the HIGH ELVES-GALADRIEL, GIL-GALAD and CIRDAN.
Three were given to the Elves, immortal, wisest...fairest of all beings. IMAGE: SEVEN RINGS held aloft in triumph by the DWARF LOR
Seven to the Dwarf Lords, great miners and craftsmen of the mountain halls. IMAGE: NINE RINGS clutched tightly by the KINGS OF MEN... if holding-close a precious secret.
And Nine...nine rings were gifted to the race of Men who, above all else, desire power.
For within these rings was bound the strength and will to govern each race.
But they were all of them deceived. FADE UP: An ancient PARCHMENT MAP of MIDDLE EARTH...movin slowly across the MAP as if drawn by an unseen force the CAMERA closes in on a PLACE NAME...MORDOR.
...for another ring was made. TEASING SHOTS: SAURON forging the ONE RING in the CHAMBER SAMMATH NAUR.

In the land of Mordor, in the fires of Mount Doom, the Dark Lord Sauron forged in secret a Master Ring to control all others. IMAGE: The ONE RING reflecting FIERY LAVA!   FIRE WRITING emerges on the plain BAND OF GOLD.
...and into this Ring he poured his cruelty, his malice and his will to dominate all life. IMAGE: THE ONE RING falls through SPACE and into flames..
One Ring to rule them all... IMAGE: A GREAT SHADOW falls across the MAP...closing in around the realm of GONDOR...
from their homes, pursued by ARMIES OF HIDEOUS ORCS.
One by one the Free lands of Middle earth fell to the power of the ring.
But there were some...who resisted.
FADE UP: ISILDUR, son of the KING OF GONDOR, leads an ARM ACROSS the PLAINS OF DAGORLAD...
A last alliance of Men and Elves marched against the armies of Mordor.
On the slopes of Mount Doom they fought for the freedom of Middle- Earth.
commands rank after rank of ELVEN ARCHERS...ORCS RETREATI before the ARMY of the LAST ALLIANCE...ELENDIL holds alof the great sword....NARSIL!
Victory was near! IMAGES: THE HUGE, DARK FIGURE OF SARURON, bearing the ONE RING on his finger, looms over the field of battle...

But the power of the Ring could not be undone. IMAGE: SAURON lays waste to the armies of the LAST ALLIAN With desperate courage, ELENDIL leads a charge...THE BLAC MACE OF SAURON LASHES OUT!! IMAGE: ELENDIL'S body falls l a crumpled rag doll... IMAGE: ISILDUR cradles the body of father in his arms. The SHADOW OF SAURON falls over him..

It was in this moment..when all hope had faded, that Isildur, son of the king, took up his father's sword. ISILDUR snatches up the BROKEN BLADE OF NARSIL..The BLADE severs SAURON'S FINGERS... AND THE ONE RING FLIES from hi body.

Sauron, the enemy of the Free Peoples of Middle Earth, was defeated. SAURON'S ARMOR clatters to the ground. His body GONE....VAPORIZED! CLOSE ON: ISILDUR picks up the SEVERED FINGER and removes the ONE RING...transfixed!
The Ring passed to Isildur...who had this one chance to destroy evil forever.
IMAGE: GLADDEN FIELD...ISILDUR leads a small column of me through DARKENING WOODS...the ONE RING glinting on a CHAI around his neck.
But the hearts of Men are easily corrupted. And the Ring of Power has a will of its own. SUDDENLY!    ARROWS FLY!   They are ambushed by ORCS...IS
FADE UP: ISILDUR MATERIALIZES UNDER WATER...as THE RING s slowly from his finger. Ripples of LIGHT play across ISILDUR'S PALE FACE...he is DEAD.
It betrayed Isildur to his death. IMAGE: THE RING falls through the MURKY WATERS of the RIV ANDUIN.
And some things that should not have been forgotten...were lost.
History became legend...legend became myth. FADE UP: The waters of the ANDUIN RIVER lie dark and undisturbed.
And for two and a half thousand years the Ring passed out of all knowledge. IMAGE: SILT SWIRLS...A THIN WHITE HAND reaches down...grasping the RING...
Until, when chance came, it ensnared a new bearer! IMAGE: THE THIN WHITE HAND opens to reveal one ring.
My Precious...

The Ring came to the creature Gollum, who took it deep into the tunnels of the Misty Mountains. IMAGE: THE GLOOM of a MOUNTAIN CAVERN..a MURKY POOL of WATER...in the DARKNESS the SHADOWY OUTLINE of an EMACIAT FIGURE.
And there, it consumed him. A RASPY VOICE mutters in the half light...
It came to me. My own.     My love... (ecstatic whisper) My preciousness.
The Ring brought to Gollum unnatural long life. For five hundred years it poisoned his mind. And in the gloom of Gollum's cave...
It waited. FADE UP: Bathed in COLD MOONLIGHT, the WORLD lies DARK an STILL...the unsettled quiet before the storm...

Darkness crept back into the forests of the world. Rumor grew of a Shadow in the East...whispers of a nameless fear. And the Ring of Power perceived...its time had now come. It abandoned Gollum. SLOW MOTION: unseen by its KEEPER..THE RING falls to the MUDDY FLOOR of a MOUNTAIN TUNNEL...
But something happened then the Ring did not intend...
IMAGE: FUMBLING in the dark, a SMALL HAND closes over the
It was picked up by the most unlikely creature imaginable...
(to himself) What's this? A YOUNGISH LOOKING BILBO BAGGINS peers down at what lies his hand...PERPLEXED by what he has found.
A Hobbit....Bilbo Baggins of the Shire.
(surprised) A Ring. SUDDENLY!   A VOICE SCREAMS...ITS ANGUISH RINGING through COLD, DANK TUNNELS...
Lost!   Lost! My Precious is lost!! Frightened Bilbo quickly POCKETS the ONE RING and hurries

head_text.subj: FASTER AND FASTER...THEIR DARK GREEN FORESTS AND JAGGED
WHITE PEAKS RECEDING INTO THE SHROUD OF MIST

text: For the time will soon come when Hobbits will shape the fortunes of all.
resting on a small rock...rising out of the LONG, OVERGRO
SHIRE....60 YEARS LATER CAMERA TRACKS TO: a Figure lies beneath the dappled sunlight of an old tree.

White flowers are scattered among the Well seeded grasses An idyllic setting at the end of a long hot summer... the figure is reading a book. ON THE SOUNDTRACK: In the dista growing louder..over the Gentle clip clop of an approachi cart and horse can be heard the HUMMING OF A DEEP VOICE t the tune of "The Road Goes Ever On and On..." SUDDENLY! The figure in the grass sits up...looking strai at camera is a handsome young HOBBIT, with dark curly hai and deep blue eyes. This is FRODO BAGGINS...his EYES alig with EXCITEMENT! Tossing away the long stem of grass in h mouth, Frodo runs off.
The cart rattles along a leafy lane, driven by a stooped figure in Grey.

head_text.subj: HILL. . .JUMPING OVER LOGS... DODGING TREE BRANCHES.

text: The shambling OLD PONY snorts and rears as... SUDDENLY FR appears on a bank above the cart.
You're late. CLOSE ON: GANDALF glowers at the young Hobbit...

A Wizard is never late, Frodo Baggins, nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he means to. They look at each other a moment..then both start laughin FRODO'S face breaks into a smile and he leaps on to the f seat of the cart.
It's wonderful to see you, Gandalf! Next to Gandalf, we see how small Hobbits are...Frodo is foot 6 inches tall.
You didn't think I'd miss your Uncle Bilbo's birthday?
Wide on: The cart rattles past a FIELD LUPIN being tended HOBBITS.
What news of the outside world? Tell me everything!
Gandalf looks down at Frodo, a twinkle in his eye.
What, everything? Far too eager and curious for a Hobbit. Most unnatural... Wide on: The cart rattles over a Stone bridge towards a B Hobbit Marketplace.

Well, what can I tell you? Life in the wide world goes on much as if it has past age. Full of its own comings and goings, scarcely even aware of the existence of Hobbits... Close on: Gandalf as he surveys the peaceful scene before him.
...for which I am very thankful.

Hobbits look up exclaiming in wonder and excitement as th cart bearing Gandalf and Frodo rolls past the Green Drago Inn...towards... Wide on: The party field. Where scOrcs o Hobbits are busy preparing for the big night.
Ah, the long expected party. So, how is the old rascal? I hear it's going to be a Party of Special Magnificence.
You know Bilbo...he's got he whole place in an uproar.
Oh, well...that should please him.
Half the Shire's been invited...
Good gracious, me.
He's up to something.
Oh, really? Frodo shoots a knowing look, as Gandalf averts his eyes.
Alright then..keep your secrets. Before you came along we Bagginses were very well thought of.
Indeed?
Never had any adventures or did anything unexpected.
If you're referring to the incident with the Dragon...I was barely involved...all I did was give your Uncle a little nudge out the door.
Whatever you did...you've been officially labelled as a Disturber of the Peace.
Oh, really?
ODO PROUDFOOT looks up as the Cart passes by, deeply suspicious.
As the cart rattles into the small village of Hobbiton... quaint rustic settlement, nestled amongst rolling green h and large trees.
The Hobbits live in Hobbit Holes: neat burrows dug into t grassy hillside, with round doors and cute front gardens.
Excited children, chasing after the cart.

Gandalf ignOrcs the children's cries. The children stand deflated, watching Gandalf disappear up the lane. At that moment: spinning balls of bright color suddenly leap out the cart, fizzing over the heads of the delighted childre
Gandalf smiling to himself, well pleased with his joke. O PROUDFOOT is unable to suppress a chuckle. Frodo stands u the cart as Gandalf reigns in the horse.
Gandalf... I'm glad you're back. Frodo leaps expertly from the cart. Gandalf smiles.
So am I, dear boy...so am I

Wide on: GANDALF'S CART pulls up outside the gate to BAG END...a particularly fine example of a Hobbit hole, with large round front door set into a grassy hillside. There a sign on the gate which reads: "NO ADMITTANCE EXCEPT ON PARTY BUSINESS." Gandalf strides up to the garden path of End. He raises his staff and raps on the front door...a voice calls out:
No, thank you! We don't want any more visitors, well wishers, or distant relations.

And what about very old friends? Suddenly the door opens and BILBO BAGGINS stands before h He is a HOBBIT OF INDERTIMINATE AGE, with a mischievous Twinkle in his eye. Wearing a dashing brocade waist coat, looks every inch the eccentric gentleman.
Gandalf?
Bilbo Baggins!
My dear Gandalf! Gandalf drops to his knee to embrace his old friend.
It's good to see you. One hundred and eleven years old, who would believe it! Gandalf looks at him more keenly.
You haven't aged a day! Gandalf and Bilbo laugh together and enter Bag End.
Come on, come in!   Welcome, welcome!!

Bilbo leads Gandalf into Bag End...cozy and cluttered wit souvenirs of Bilbo's travels. Gandalf has to stoop to avo hitting his head on the low ceiling. Bilbo hangs up Ganda hat on a peg and trots off down the hall.

(Calling) Tea? Or maybe something stronger... I've a few bottles of the Old Winyard left, 1296...a very good year, almost as old as I am. It was laid down by my father. What say we open one, eh? Bilbo disappears into the kitchen as Gandalf looks around..enjoying the familiarity of Bag End...he turns, knocking his head on the light and then walking into the wooden beam. He groans.
I was expecting you some time last week. Not that it matters, you come and go as you please, always have done, always will.

You've caught me a bit unprepared, I'm afraid...we've only got cold chicken, bit of pickle, some cheese here...ooh, no, that might be a little risky... Gandalf stops in front of a framed map, charred in one corner...it is Thorin's map of the Lonely Mountain, Ganda smiles to himself.

Er, we've got raspberry jam and apple tart...got some custard somewhere. Not much for Afters, I'm afraid. Oh no...we're alright...I've just found some sponge cake. Nice little snack. Hope it's enough. (comes into view) I could do you some eggs if you like? Bilbo jumps, a half eaten pork pie in his hand, as Gandal mysteriously appears behind him.
Just tea, thank you.
Oh..right.     You don't mind if...?
No, not at all. Go ahead. A sudden loud knock on the front door.
Bilbo Baggins, you open this door..I know you're in there
I'm not home. Gandalf watches, amused as Bilbo tries to hide.

I've got to get away from these confounded relatives, hanging on the bell all day, never giving me a moment's peace. I want to see mountains again...mountains, Gandalf... and then find somewhere quiet where I can finish my book...Oh, Tea!
So, you mean to go through with your plan, then?
Yes, yes...it's all inhand.   All the arrangements are made.
Frodo suspects something.
'Course he does, he's a Baggins...not some block headed Bracegirdle from Hardbottle!
You will tell him, won't you?
Yes, yes.
He's very fond of you.

I know. He'd probably come with me if I asked him. I think, in his heart, Frodo's still in love with the Shire, the woods and the fields... little rivers. Bilbo stands gazing out of the kitchen window.
I am old, Gandalf... Bilbo looks at Gandalf sadly...
I know I don't look it, but I'm beginning to feel it in my heart.
Bilbo's fingers close around his waistcoat pocket...gripp a small, unseen object.
I feel thin...sort of stretched, like butter scraped over too much bread. I need a holiday...a very long holiday and I don't expect I shall return...in fact, I mean not to.
Gandalf and Bilbo are sitting on the Bag End porch. Below them, final preparations are being made on the Party fiel Bilbo strikes a match and lights his pipe.
Old Toby, the finest weed in Southfarthing! Bilbo blows a perfect smoke ring and watches it rise into air. A tiny sailing ship with masts and sails glides thro the Center of Bilbo's smoke ring.
Ohhhh, (smiles) Gandalf my old friend...this will be a night to remember!

BOOM! A FIREWORK explodes into the night sky high above Hobbiton...in the shape of a great green tree with unfold branches. TILT DOWN: with glowing flowers as they rain do from the branches...evaporating just above the up turned faces of the delighted party-goers 144 Hobbits, feasting drinking Carts of beer and wine are scattered about, and tables are piled high with steaming scones and savories. Gandalf hurries about, lighting fireworks with a blue spa that dances magically from his staff... Bilbo is greeting visitors. Frodo and SAM sit at a table drinking ale...Fro notices Sam's eyes keep flicking to another pretty Hobbit Rosie Cotton, sitting some distance away.
Go on, Sam, ask Rosie for a dance.
(horrified) I think I'll just have myself another ale.
Oh, no you don't. Go on. Sam goes to drain his glass... suddenly it is snatched ou his hands as Frodo thrusts him into the middle of a passi throng of dancers.
as he is Swept away.   Frodo laughs and finishes Sam's be

Gandalf as he sets alight a particularly spectacular fire that draws gasps of admiration from the party guests. Close on: Bilbo is relating stories of his adventure to a group of young hobbit children.

(melodramatic) So, there I was...at the mercy of three monstrous trolls...Have you ever heard of a troll? Do you know what a Troll is? Great big nasty twenty foot high smelly things..and they're arguing...arguing about how they were going to cook us!
upturned face...her eyes growing larger and larger.

Whether it be turned on a spit or minced in a pie or whether they were going to sit on us one by one and squash us into jelly! But they spent so long arguing the whether-to's and why-for's that the sun's first light crept over the top of the trees...and turned them all to stone! STUNNED GASPS from his young Audience greet his astonishi feat! Close on: MERRY AND PIPPIN, two mischievous Young Hobbits in their late teens. Pippin scrambles on to the b of Gandalf's wagon, snatching up a small firework

(urgent whisper) No, no..the big one...the big one! Pippin grabs a huge rocket. CLOSE ON: FIREWORK FUSE crackles with flame! Merry is holding out the big rocket...he looks aghast at fizzing fuse that Pippin has just lit.
(worried whisper) You're supposed to stick it in the ground!
It is in the ground. Merry fearfully tosses the Rocket to Pippin!    The fuse sizzles angrily.
Outside!

It was your idea. Pippin attempts to throw the fizzing rocket back to Merry WHOOSH! The two hobbits are suddenly blown off their feet a shower of sparks as the rocket blasts off with frighten power. The ROCKET ZOOMS over the Party..It suddenly burst apart, forming the shape of a great red golden Dragon! Fi gushes from its nostrils as it turns back and Flies low towards the startled crowd. Close on: Frodo watches the Fireworks Dragon with alarm...but Bilbo is oblivious to t Panicking crowd and impending danger!
Bilbo!   Watch out for the dragon!!
Dragon? Nonsense...hasn1t been a dragon in these parts for a thousand years!

As he hurriedly pulls Bilbo to the ground, just as the dr roars a few feet above their heads like a flaming express train! Hobbits dive to the ground, tables overturn, tents collapse, food flies everywhere. The fireworks dragon tur somersault and explodes over the hills with a deafening b This gets the biggest Cheer of the night.
clothes and hair smoking.
That was good!
Let's get another one! LARGE HANDS suddenly clamp down on Merry and Pippin's ear Low angle: Gandalf looking DOWN STERNLY!
Meridoc Brandybuck and Peregrin Took...I might have known!
Are leaning over a barrel, washing dishes in soapy water...with Gandalf sitting nearby, smoking his pipe and sipping an ale. Cries of "SPEECH! SPEECH" erupt from the party.
Bilbo stepping on a stool...he bows in gratitude at the applause.
Speech!
(clearing throat) My dear Bagginses, and Boffins, tooks and Brandybucks...Grubbs, Chubbs, Hornblowers, Bolgers, Bracegirdles and Proudfoots...
Proudfeet!
Today is my one hundred and eleventh birthday. Yes, and alas...Eleventy- one years is far too short a time to live among such excellent and admirable Hobbits! Tremendous outburst of approval!

I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you as well as well as you deserve. SCATTERED CLAPPING as the guests try to work out if that a compliment or not. CLOSE ON: FRODO AND GANDALF smiling themselves. CLOSE ON: Bilbo...a strange hum seems to fill head. A bead of sweat rolls down his brow. Bilbo's hand pulls something out of his waistcoat pocket holds it behind his back.
I have..things to do and I have put this off for far too long... CLOSE ON: BILBO'S knuckles turn white as he tightens his grip on the small object behind his back.
I regret to announce, this is the end. I am going now. I bid you all a very fond farewell!! Bilbo looks across at Frodo, hesitates... then...
(whisper) Goodbye. Bilbo instantly vanishes. The party explodes into an uproar... the crowd leaps to its feet.
staring at the empty stool in disbelief.
The party is still in an excited uproar... some 50 yards as we pan across a moonlit lane to the front door of Bag Door opens, pulled by an invisible hand.
The door quietly closes...Bilbo materializes as he pulls plain gold ring off his finger. Bilbo laughs as he tosses ring in the air, then places it in his pocket.
Bilbo emerges from the passage, carrying a walking stick. finds Gandalf looming over him.
I suppose you think that was terribly clever?
Come on, Gandalf!   Did you see their faces?
There are many magic rings in the world, Bilbo Baggins, and none of them should be used lightly.
It was just a bit of fun.   Oh, you're probably right as usual.
You will keep an eye on Frodo, won't you?
I'm leaving everything to him.
What about this ring of yours?   Is that staying too? Close on: Bilbo...he gives Gandalf a look and nods toward mantelpiece.
Yes, yes, it's in an envelope...over there on the mantelpiece. Gandalf frowns at the empty mantelpiece...Bilbo suddenly feels his waistcoat with a look of guilty surprise.
No, wait. It's here in my pocket. Isn't that...isn't' that odd now? Yet, after all, why not? Why shouldn't I keep it?
I think you should leave the Ring behind, Bilbo. Is that so hard?
Well, no...and yes. Now it comes to it, I don't feel like parting with it. It's mine. I found it. It came to me!
There's no need to get angry.
Well, if I'm angry, it's your fault! It's mine. My own, my precious.
Precious? It's been called that before, but not by you.
So? What business is it of yours what I do with my own things? Bilbo's voice, shape and manner have suddenly changed.
I think you've had that ring quite long enough.
You want it for yourself! Gandalf rises to his full height, his eyes flash, his sha suddenly seems to fill the room
Bilbo Baggins do not take me for some conjurer of cheap tricks! Bilbo cowers from Gandalf, disarmed by his power...a frightened Hobbit. Gandalf's expression softens.
I am not trying to rob you. I am trying to help you. Sobbing, Bilbo runs to Gandalf and hugs him.
All you long years we've been friends...trust me as you once did. Let it go!
You're right, Gandalf...the ring must go to Frodo. Bilbo lifts his knapsack and heads for the front door.
It's late, the road is long... yes, it is time.
Bilbo?
Hmmm?
The ring is still in your pocket. Bilbo hesitates...reaches into his pocket.

Oh, yes. CLOSE ON: Bilbo pulls out the ring...he stares at it in h palm. With all his will power, Bilbo allows the ring to slowly slide off his palm and drop to the floor. CLOSE ON The tiny ring lands with a heavy thud on the wooden floor
Bilbo staggering out of Bag end...he braces himself in th night air, Pale and Trembling, as if his loss of the ring weakened him. Gandalf steps up behind.
I've thought up and ending for my book..."And he lived happily ever after to the end of his days."
I'm sure you will, my dear friend.
Goodbye, Gandalf.
Goodbye Bilbo. Bilbo walks away from Bag End, disappearing into the nigh softly singing: "The Road goes on and on."
(softly) Until our next meeting.

CLOSE ON: THE RING...Glinting on the floor...Gandalf circ around it, a Puzzled look on his face. Gandalf slowly rea for the ring. His fingers barely touch the ring...the cre Hum rises on the soundtrack. Gandalf is sitting in front the fire, with his pipe...staring into the flickering fla
It's mine, my own, my precious.
(to himself) Riddles in the dark.
Bilbo! Bilbo! Frodo rushes into Bag End...he stops and picks up the rin his feet. Gandalf continues staring into the fire, as if locked in thought.
(to himself) My precious...precious..
(quietly) He's gone, hasn't he? Frodo steps into the living room.
He talked for so long about leaving...I didn't think he'd really do it.
(mutters to himself) ...my own.
Gandalf? Gandalf turns...his eyes locking onto the ring in Frodo's fingers.
Bilbo's ring. Gandalf sorts hurriedly through Bilbo's papers...
He's gone to stay with the Elves. He's left you Bag End... Gandalf holds out the envelope...Frodo drops the ring int it.
...along with all his possessions. Gandolf seals the envelope with wax.   He hands it to Fro
The ring is yours now. But it somewhere out of sight. Gandalf rises hurriedly and starts to gather his things.
Where are you going?
I have some things I must see to.
What things?
Questions.     Questions that need answering.
You've only just arrived!    I don't understand... Gandalf is already at the door, he turns to Frodo.
Neither do I. Keep it secret, keep it safe. Gandalf hurries out the door...leaving FRODO standing alo in the Bag End.
The camera pushes in...the hum of the ring comes up on th soundtrack. The camera pushes through the white paper to ring...beneath the hum the whispered murmur of BLACK SPEE can be heard.

The jagged ruins of" BARAD-DUR. THE DARK TOWER! TEASING IMAGES: THE HUGE DARK TOWER OF BARAD-DUR is being rebuilt Thousands of ORCS crawl over the surface, hauling stone a iron up the towering heights.
grows and spreads across the red streaked sky...casting a shadowy pall over the nightmarish landscape.
Baggins!    Shire!!
NINE BLACK RIDERS burst out of Minas Morgul and charge to Camera.

WIDE ON: A LONE HORSEMAN gallops to the crest of a hill o the west road. The main highway south to Minas Tirith...h looks toward the saw toothed mountains of Mordor... ...seeping out across the blood red sky, his face grave. spurs his horse on.
making is way down into the lower depths of the Citidel.
CLOSE ON: Pages flipping as Gandalf searches ancient scro and books placed high on a wooden table. His eyes settle one old parchment. He murmurs hurriedly to himself, readi
(reading) The year 3434 of the Second Age...here follows the account of Isildur, High King of Gondor, and the finding of the ring of power.
(reading) It has come to me...the ring of power!
It shall be an heirloom of my Kingdom...all those who follow in my bloodline shall be bound to its fate, for I will risk no hurt to the
ring...it is precious to me, though I buy it with great pain...
(reading) The marking upon the band begin to fade...the writing which at first was as clear as red flame, has all but disappeared...a secret now that only fire can tell...

FARMER MAGGOT is chopping wood in his garden CLOSE ON: SNORTING HORSE NOSTRILS...as the shadow of a black rider looms over a Hobbit House. Terrified, FARMER MAGGOT cower his doorway...FANG, his dog, Whimpers and backs away.
(hissing) Shire? Baggins?
(terrified) There's no Bagginses around here! They are all up in Hobbiton...that way. The BLACK RIDER GALLOPS AWAY AT SPEED
bids the last of the Patron's "Goodnight"...Sam meets her eyes for a moment as he and Frodo leave the inn.
WIDE ON: FRODO FAREWELLS SAM outside Bag End, and heads towards the front door. Creepy POV from inside Bag end: F coming up the path.

FRODO enters Bag End...he immediately Pauses, sensing tha something is amiss. All is quiet...Frodo peers uneasily i the darkened living room. SUDDENLY! A large figure looms of the shadows, reaching for Frodo. Frodo lets out a startled cry, pulls himself free and spins around to face Assailant. Gandalf steps into a shaft of moonlight. Paran blazes in his eyes. His clothes are dirty and ragged from much traveling. Hair and beard much longer an unkempt.
(urgent whisper) Is it secret? Is it safe?
Frodo pulls the envelope out of an old chest. Gandalf, suspicious, Alert. Without a word, Gandalf takes the enve and tosses it into the fireplace!
(bewildered) What are you doing? Flames instantly consume the envelope...revealing the rin as it sinks into the red hot embers. Gandalf reaches into fire with a pair of tongs...he lifts the ring out.
Hold out your hand, Frodo...it is quite cool. Gandalf drops the ring into Frodo's hand...he reacts to i weight.
What can you see? Can you see anything?
Nothing...there's nothing.   Wait...
CLOSE ON: The Gold Band of the ring as fiery letters begi appear...a tiny inscription glows red...as if burning fro within.
...these are markings.
It's some form of Elvish...I can't read it.
(ominous) There are few who can...the language is that of Mordor, which I will not utter here. Mordor?
In the common tongue it says, "One ring to rule them all, ring to find them, One ring to bring them all, and in the darkness bind them."
CLOSE ON: The ring lies on Frodo's simple kitchen table.
This is the one ring forged by the dark lord, Sauron, in the fires of Mt Doom...taken by Isildur from the hand of Sauron himself.
(quiet realization) Bilbo found it...in Gollom's cave.
For sixty years the ring lay quiet in Bilbo's keeping, prolonging his life, delaying old age...but no longer, Frodo. Evil is stirring in Mordor. The ring has awoken. It has heard its master's call.
of BLACK SPEECH emanates from the Ring.   Frodo looks at Gandalf, each kn the other has heard it.
But he was destroyed...Sauron was destroyed.
lies between them on the table.

No, Frodo. The spirit of Sauron has endured. His life force is bound to the ring and the ring survived. Sauron has returned. His Orcs have multiplied...his fortress of Barad- dur is rebuilt in the land of Mordor. Sauron needs only this ring to cover all the lands in the second darkness. He is seeking it, seeking it, all his thought is bent on it. For the ring yearns, above all else, to return to the hand of its master: they are one, the ring and the dark lord. Frodo, he must never find out. SUDDENLY Frodo scoops up the Ring.
Alright!
hurriedly entering the living room.
(thinking fast) We put it away, we keep it hidden! We never speak of it again. No one know it's here, do they? Gandalf shifts uncomfortably.
Do they, Gandalf? Gandalf looks at Frodo, sadly...
There is one other who knew that Bilbo had the Ring. I looked everywhere for the creature Gollum, but the enemy found him first.
CLOSE ON: A teasing Glimpse of Gollum being tortured by t Orcs. The wretched creature screams in pain.
I don't know how long they tortured him...but amidst the endless screams and inane babble, they discerned two words.
(screaming) S...Shire! Baggins!
Shire!   Baggins!   That will lead them here!
IMAGE: On a dark country lane, a Hobbit bounder lifts his watch lantern in alarm.
Halt!    Who goes there? Out of the darkness thunder two BLACK RIDERS...A LETHAL S swings down at the small Hobbit bounder.
FRODO thrusts the ring at Gandalf.
Take it!   Take it!
No, Frodo...
You must take it.
You cannot offer me this ring.
I'm giving it to you!
Don't tempt me, Frodo. I dare not take it, not even to keep it safe. CLOSE ON: THE RING IN FRODO'S HAND...
Understand, Frodo...I would use this Ring from a desire to do good...but through me, it would wield a power too great and terrible to imagine.
But it cannot stay in the Shire!
No, no it can't. CLOSE ON: THE RING IN FRODO'S CLENCHED HAND.
What must I do?
throwing clothes into a knapsack...Gandalf watches him, making plans...
You must leave, and leave quickly. Get out of the Shire.
Where?   Where shall I go?
Make for the village of Bree.
Bree?   What about you?
I will, be waiting for you at the Inn of the Prancing Pony. Frodo packs his food into his knapsack.
And the ring will be safe there?
I don't know, Frodo. I don't have any answers. I must see the Head of my Order. He is both wise and powerful. Trust me, Frodo. He'll know what to go.
Frodo is preparing to leave.
You'll have to leave the name of Baggins behind you...for that name is not safe outside the Shire. GANDALF helps FRODO into his coat.
Travel only by day and stay off the road.
(thinking) I can cut across country easily enough. Gandalf looks at the young Hobbit, moved by his courage.

My dear Frodo, Hobbits really are amazing creatures. You can learn all that there is to know about their ways in a month, and yet, after a hundred years, they can still surprise you. SUDDENLY!    A SOUND from outside.
Get down! GANDALF FREEZES... he moves quietly towards the window, e wide with tension. He raises his staff above the window, slams it down on the intruder. THERE IS A YELP OF PAIN!
Gandalf hauls a small figure into the room...SAM GAMGEE sprawls across the floor! He looks up in terror as Gandal looms over him.
(angry) Confound it all! Samwise Gamgee, have you been eavesdropping?
I ain't been dropping no eaves, sir! Honest. I was just cutting the grass under the window there, if you follow me...
It's a little late for trimming the hedges, don't you think?
I heard raised voices...
What did you hear?   Speak!

(panicked) Nothing important...that is, I heard a good deal about a ring...and a Dark Lord. And something about the end of the world, but...Please, Mr. Gandalf, sir, don't hurt me! Don't turn me into anything unnatural!
No?
Perhaps not. I've thought of a better use for you.

Wide on: HOBBITON...shrouded in a white veil of MIST. WID To reveal Gandalf, Frodo and Sam hurrying across a plough field, away from Hobbiton! Gandalf leads his Horse...Frod and Sam are carrying knapsacks.
Come along, Samwise...keep up...
Gandalf leads Frodo and Sam under the cover of Woods.
Be careful, both of you. The Enemy has many spies in his service, many ways of hearing...birds, beasts... Gandalf takes Frodo to one side...
(low voice) Is it safe? FRODO NODS...he pats his pocket.

Never put it on, for then the agents of the Dark Lord will be drawn to its power...Always remember, Frodo, the ring is trying to get back to its master...it wants to be found. Gandalf wheels his horse and gallops away.
MONTAGE: FRODO AND SAM hiking over the gentle Shire Countryside...wading through a shallow stream...heating a kettle over a small fire...clambering over stone walls.
Sam stops short...taking stock of his surroundings.    Sa looks back from where they came.
This is it.
This is what?
If I take one more step it'll be the farthest away from home I've ever been. FRODO gives Sam a pat on the shoulder.
Come on, Sam. Sam takes a deep breath and steps forward. CLOSE ON: SAM' brown, furry foot hits the ground. FRODO IS SMILING.
Remember what Bilbo used to say...it's a dangerous business... Frodo and Sam continue their journey.
... it's a dangerous business, Frodo, going out your door...you step onto the road, and if you don't keep your feet, there's not knowing where you might be swept off to.
Gandalf is galloping along the outskirts of the ancient forest of Fangorn. Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant Misty Mountains, the tall black tower of Orthanc clearly visible

Gandalf gallops through the gate, into the fortress of ISENGARD...a great ring-wall of stone, a mile from rim to rim, encloses beautiful trees and gardens, watered by str that flow down from the mountains.

Smoke rises once more from the mountain of doom...the shadow takes shape in the darkness of Mordor; the hour grows late...and Gandalf the Grey rides to Isengard seeking my counsel... The strange tower of Orthanc...hewn from a solid pillar o black obsidian...rises up in the center of the Isengard Circle. Gandalf arrives at the foot of the Orthanc Stairs
he sweeps down the Orthanc stairs.
For that is why you have come, is it not, my old friend? Gandalf moves quickly towards him, grimy and weary from h long ride.
Saruman!
Gandalf and Saruman walk slowly between the beautiful tre of Isengard, Saruman's clean, white robe contrasts with Gandalf's dusty grey robes.
Are you sure of this?
Beyond any doubt.
So the ring of power has been found?
All these long years it was in the Shire, under my very nose.
And yet you did not have the wit to see it! Your love of the Halfling's leaf has clearly slowed your mind.
We still have time...time enough to counter Sauron...if we act quickly.
Time?   What time do you think we have?
Saruman and Gandalf are seated in a small, cluttered room the side of the cavernous central chamber.

Sauron has regained much of his former strength. He cannot yet take physical form...but his spirit has lost none of its potency. Concealed within his fortress, the lord of Mordor sees all. His gaze pierces cloud, shadow, earth, and flesh. You know of what I speak, Gandalf...a great Eye, lidless, wreathed in flame.
(softly) The eye of Sauron.
He is gathering all evil to him.
Very soon he will have summoned an army great enough to launch an assault upon Middle earth.
You know this? How?
I have seen it. Gandalf and Saruman stride through Orthanc toward a stone plinth on which a sphere like shape is draped with a clot
A palantir is a dangerous tool, Saruman. Saruman lifts the cloth to reveal the Palantir.
Why?   Why should we fear to use it?
They are not all accounted for, the lost seeing-stones...we do not know who else may be watching. Gandalf throws the cloth back over the Palantir.
Saruman sits upon his throne.
The hour is later than you think. Sauron's forces are already moving...the Nine have left Minas Morgul.
(shocked) The nine!
They crossed the river Isen in Midsummer's eve, disguised as riders in black.
(alarmed) They have reached the Shire? Saruman shrugs...
They will find the ring...and kill the one who carries it. Gandalf backs away and turns to run to the door...horrifi as the doors suddenly slam shut.
You did not seriously think a Hobbit could contend with the will of Sauron? There are none who can. Gandalf slowly turns to Saruman...a look of dawning horro
Against the power of Mordor, there can be no victory. We must join with him, Gandalf. We must join with Sauron. It would be wise, my friend.

(deadly) Tell me, friend, when did Saruman the wise abandon reason for madness? At that moment: Gandalf is suddenly blasted across the ro He slams against the wall...pinned there by some unseen force. With sudden effort, Gandalf wrenches himself off t wall and swings his staff on Saruman...blasting him off h feet! Gandalf and Saruman battle, powerful blasts throwin them across the room. SARUMAN SCREAMS, EYES BLAZING! Gandalf's staff is suddenly wrenched from his grasp...it flies across the chamber into Saruman's hand! Gandalf is flung to the floor.

I gave you the chance of aiding me willingly, but you have elected the way of pain. Gandalf is breathing hard on the floor, his eyes look int the madness of Saruman... Commanding two staffs, Saruman sends Gandalf into a sickening spin. Gandalf tumbles towa the top of the chamber...as if falling in reverse. Rushin POV: the roof of Orthanc rockets toward camera.
Wide on: Frodo and Sam walking along a country lane which borders Farmer Maggot's Fields. Sam is looking up...Frodo disappeared around a corner in the lane.
(panicked) Mr. Frodo. Mr. Frodo! Frodo turns, surprised as Sam comes running towards him.
(worried) I thought I lost you. Frodo looks at Sam suspiciously. Sam glances down, embarrassed.
(teasing) What are you talking about?
(mumbling) It's just something Gandalf said...
What did he say?
He said..."Don't you leave him, Samwise Gamgee." (looks at Frodo intently) And I don't mean to.
(laughing) Sam...we're still in the Shire...what could possibly happen?
SUDDENLY! A figure comes crashing out of a hedgerow sendi Frodo flying. Frodo picks himself up, only to be knocked down again by Pippin.
Frodo!   Merry, it's Frodo Baggins.
Hello Frodo Merry, Pippin, and Frodo picking themselves up... a varie of vegetables have scattered everywhere.
What's the meaning of this!
Sam, hold this... Merry gives Sam a large cabbage.
(accusing) You've been into Farmer Maggot's crop! A large pitchfork can be seen racing towards them along t Hedgerow...angry shouts from Farmer Maggot.

Who's that in my field!     Get out of it! Get out of my field, you    young varmits! I'll show you...get out    of my corn. Merry and Pippin hurriedly gather their booty and race away...with Frodo and Sam on their heels.
(looking behind him) I don't know why he's so upset, it's only a couple of carrots.
And some cabbages...and those three bags of potatoes that we lifted last week. And then the mushrooms the week before.
Yes, Pippin, my point is, he's clearly over reacting. The BAYING OF LARGE DOGS sounds!
Run!
Frodo, Sam, and Merry and Pippin tumble head over heels d a bank, onto a dark, wooded road. CLOSE ON: A winded Pipp his face inches away from a large pile of Horse droppings
That was close. Frodo picks himself up and looks around quickly.
(groaning) Ow...I think I've broken something. Pulls a LARGE CARROT, almost broken through in the middle out from his back pocket.
Oh.
(turning on Merry and Pippin) Trust a Brandybuck and a Took.
What? That was just a detour...a shortcut.
A shortcut to what? Pippin has spied something under the trees on the far sid the road.

(excited) Mushrooms! CLOSE ON: SMALL, brown mushrooms growing amongst the Loam undergrowth. Sam, Merry, and Pippin race toward the mushrooms! Frodo is tense and watchful. He realizes they on a wooded road. Scattered leaves rise into the air Whir down the road as if blown by an invisible wind...

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY... THE SOUND OF HORSES HOOVES...

text: I think we should get off the road. A long drawn WAIL comes down the wind, like the cry of so evil and lonely creature.

(more urgency) Get off the road! Sam grabs Merry and Pippin as the Hobbits quickly scrambl down the bank, hiding under a mossy log. THE SOUND OF HOO is close... A sinister MOUNTED RINGWRATH steps into view...hooded and faceless, mounted on a huge snarling bl horse with insane eyes ! Frodo freezes in terror. The RINGWRAITH pauses right beside their hiding place...he si very still with his head bowed, listening. From inside th hood comes a sniffing noise as if he is trying to catch a elusive scent; his head turning from side to side.
Beads of sweat gather on his brow. The ringwraith suddenl slides off his horse, leaning over the mossy log, peering suspiciously into the woods.

He is drawing the ring out of his pocket, with trembling hands...his face fevered and sweating as if in the grip o some terrible INTERNAL STRUGGLE. The SOUND OF SNIFFING intensifies as the ringwraith darts his head from side to side like a bird of party. CLOSE ON: FRODO SQUEEZING HIS EYES SHUT...

Frodo? Merry desperately hurls the mushrooms across the road...t ringwraith spins around at the sound, and darts to the fa side of the road with frightening speed. Frodo instantly slumps...as if a PSYCHIC LINK had been broken
What was that? Frodo is staring, a look of shock on his face at the ring lying in the palm of his hand.
Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin hurry through the trees...slipping and sliding on the muddy ground.
Anything?
Nothing.
What is going on? Merry moves past pippin, toward Frodo, watching intently...Sam keeps looking around nervously.
The Black rider was looking for something...or someone...Frodo?
Get down! The SILHOUETTE OF A BLACK RIDER looms against the skyline The Four Hobbits... sprawled on the ground, holding their breath. The BLACK RIDER turns and departs.
I have to leave the Shire...Sam and I must get to Bree. Merry looks at his friend...realizing Frodo is in deep trouble.
Right...Buckleberry Ferry...follow me ! The Hobbits break cover. SUDDENLY, A RINGWRAITH bursts ou the forest TOWARD THEM!
There's another one!! Frodo, this way! ! The Hobbits run   THE RINGWRAITH SHRIEKS!
Black horse hooves... snarling horse mouths...a fleeting black cowl.
Frodo, follow me!
FRODO, SAM, MERRY AND PIPPIN, are running towards the wid placid Brandywine river...and the FERRY.

Get the ropes, Sam. QUICK ANGLES: STOMPING HOOVES...SNARLING HORSES... Four RINGWRAITHS are speeding through the Fog...convergin the FERRY CROSSING. The HOBBITS stampede across the Wharf Tumble onto the Ferry.
(screaming) Frodo! Frodo races across the Wooden Wharf, followed by the ringwraiths. He leaps into the Ferry.

Sam and Merry shove off with the poles...the ferry slides into the river, just as the ringwraiths arrive. They pull on the end of the wharf... shrieking with rage! The Hobbi cover their ears. The Ringwraiths wheel their horses towa the north and Gallop away along the river bank, quickly disappearing into the fog.
How far to the nearest crossing?
The brandwine bridge...twenty miles.
Lights of Bree...a small village of stone and half timber houses nestled against a low wooded hill.
A thick hedge surrounds the village...a great gate bars t western entrance.
FRODO, SAM, MERRY AND PIPPIN approaching the gatehouse... eyes, ragged, and out of breath.
Come on. A SURLY GATEKEEPER glances down at them.
What do you want?
We're headed for the prancing pony. The gatekeeper swings his lantern onto the hobbits, bathi them in an uncomfortable yellow spotlight.
Hobbits! Four Hobbits, and what's more, out of the Shire by your talk. What business brings you to Bree?
We wish to stay at the inn...our business is our own. To Frodo's relief, the Gatekeeper unlocks the gate.
All right, young sir, I meant no offense. The Hobbits gratefully enter Bree...the gatekeeper eyeing them curiously in the lantern light.
It's my job to ask questions after nightfall. There's talk of strange fold abroad...can't be too careful.

The tall BREE FOLK loom over the nervous little hobbits a Frodo, Sam, Merry and Pippin make their way through the Narrow Streets. Tall buildings tower above them...lights glow dimly from behind thick curtains.
Close on: The sign of the "PRANCING PONY INN"...Frodo, Sa Merry, and Pippin hurry toward it.
Frodo, Sam, Merry and Pippin come rushing in.   Frodo att the INN KEEPERS'S attention.
Excuse me.
Good evening, little masters. If you're seeking accommodation, we've got some nice, cozy Hobbit sized rooms available, Mr...ah...
Underhill...my name's Underbill.
Underhill?     Hmmmm.
We're friends of Gandalf the Grey...can you tell him we've arrived? BUTTERBUR frowns...
(Puzzled) Gandalf...Gandalf...Oh... (recognition) Oh yes! I remember...elderly chap...big grey beard...pointy hat? Frodo nods with relief...Butterbur shakes his head.
Not seen him for six months. Frodo is shocked.
(worried whisper) What do we do now?

Wide on: the noise, smokey Inn. It is dimly lit, cheifly from a blazing log fire...and crowded with a mixture of B FOLK, LOCAL HOBBITS, and a couple of dwarfs. Frodo, Sam, Merry and Pippin are sitting at a table against the wall. clearly trying to remain Quiet and inconspicuous... Sam c help himself...he keeps casting nervous glances around.
Sam, he'll be here.    He'll come. Merry ploinks himself down at a table, carrying a very la mug of beer.
What's that?
This, my friend, is a pint.
It comes in pints?    I'm getting one! Sam watches Pippin rise unsteadily to his feet and head t the bar.
You've had a whole half already. Merry watches Pippin go. A COUPLE OF SWARTHY MEN leaning against the bar glance at Frodo, then quickly look away.

(tense) That fellow's done nothing but stare at you since we've arrived. Sam indicates a BROODING STRANGER who sits alone at a tab in the far corner, smoking a curiously carved long stemme pipe, peering from beneath a travel stained cowl with gleaming eyes. Frodo gestures to Butterbur...
Excuse me, that man in the corner, who is he?
He's one of them Rangers; they're dangerous folk they are, wandering the wilds. What his right name is, I never heard, but round here he's known as Strider.
(to himself) Strider. BENEATH TABLE: FRODO'S fingers are nervously TOYING WITH RING.
Sweat runs down his brow.   The Strange hum of the Ring s into the Soundtrack. "Baggins...Baggins..." a creepy whisper seems to fill Fro head...sound that dissolves into Pippin's loud voice:
Baggins? Sure, I know a Baggins...he's over there...
sitting at the bar, chatting with Locals.   Frodo leaps t feet and pushes his way towards the bar.

(loudly) Frodo Baggins. He's my second cousin once removed, on his mother's side and my third cousin twice removed on his father's side...if you follow me. Frodo grabs Pippin's sleeve, spilling his beer.
Pippin!
Steady on, Frodo! Pippin pushes Frodo away...he stumbles backwards, and fal to the floor. At that instant, the Inn goes silent and al the attention turns to Frodo...

The ring...in agonizing Slow motion we watch as it seems hang in the air for a split second...then crashes down on his out stretched finger. FRODO VANISHES! There is a shar intake of breath...followed by total silence.
The RINGWRAITHS turn sharply in their saddles...Instantly aware that the ring is being worn. They spur their horses towards the distant lights of Bree.
Sam looks sick; Pippin instantly sobers, realizing his fo the brooding stranger frowns...and the inn erupts into excited babble.

FRODO: as he finds himself in the TWILIGHT WORLD of the r THE EXCITED CROWD ARE suddenly moving in slow motion...distorted voices...a weird photographic negative quality. FRODO is moving in real time; against the slow motion background. He suddenly clutches his head as he is hit with quick images...of a GREAT EYE! AN EVIL CAT-LIKE EYE, wreathed in flames.

There is no life here in the void...only cold...only deat FRODO is terrified! He rolls under a table, desperately pulling the ring from his finger. FRODO MATERIALIZES into real world. AT THAT MOMENT: A LARGE HAND reaches under th table and Grabs Frodo by the collar, and DRAGS HIM AWAY!
Frodo is roughly pushed against the wall.    The Brooding stranger looms over him.
You draw far too much attention to yourself...Mr. Underhill
Frodo is pushed into the Hobbit's room by Strider.
What do you want?
A little more caution from you...that is no trinket you carry.
I carry nothing.
Indeed? I can usually avoid being seen if I wish, but to disappear entirely... that is a rare gift.
Who are you?
Are you frightened?
Yes.

Not nearly frightened enough. I know what hunts you. Frodo jumps at the sound of a noise in the corridor. Strider deftly draws his sword. The door bursts open and Sam, Merry and Pippin appear on doorway. Sam is Squaring off with is fists, Merry brandis a candlestick, and Pippin a chair.
(angry) Let him go or I'll have you, Longshanks! STRIDER SHEATHS his sword, a slight smile playing on his lips.
You have a stout heart, little Hobbit, but that alone won't save you...You can no longer wait for the Wizard, Frodo. They're coming.
The gate keeper comes out of his Lodgings with a lantern. look of fear on his face. He approaches the closed gate w great apprehension. CLOSE ON: The Gatekeeper peers out of Peephole.
The gate crashed down on the gatekeeper...as four RINGWRA ride into Bree!
The four RINGWRAITHS fly done the empty streets, like horsemen of the apocalypse.
LOW ANGLE: the front door FLIES OPEN. The FOUR RINGWRAITH rush into the PRANCING PONY with WICKED SWORDS DRAWN. CLO ON: BUTTERBUR hiding behind his bar... trembling and swea in TERROR.

INSERT: PIPPIN stirs slightly, then settles back to sleep WIDE ON: the door creaks open...THE FOUR RINGWRAITHS sile slide into the Hobbit's room. The LOOM above each bed, raising their SHINING SWORDS ABOVE THE SLEEPING HOBBITS. QUICK INSERT: Sam's eyes open wide. In unison, the RINGWR STAB THE HOBBITS, in a Slashing, hacking frenzy.
Strider is grimly listening to the sounds from his room.

Wide on: the RINGWRAITHS step back from the slashed beds triumph. CLOSE ON: a hacked blanket is pulled back to rev nothing but a shredded pillow. The RINGWRAITHS SHRIEK WIT RAGE!! INSERTS: Sam sits up with a start! Close on: Anoth shredded pillow is revealed! More Shrieks of rage. INSERT PIPPIN AND MERRY wake with a start.

WIDE ON: Sam, Merry, and Pippin have been sleeping on Strider's bed. Frodo stands next to Strider by the window peering out nervously as furious Ringwraith screeches ech across the courtyard from the Hobbits room.
Where are they?
They were once men. Strider glances quickly at Frodo, then looks away...

(quietly) Great Kings of men. Then Sauron the deceiver gave to them Nine Rings of Power. Blinded by their greed they took them without question, one by one falling into darkness and now they are slaves to his will. Strider looks from the window as the Ringwraiths gallop d the Bree Streets. CLOSE ON: Strider turns back to the Hobbits, his face lit faintly by the Glowing Embers of th Fire.
They are the Nazgul, Ringwraiths, neither living or dead. At all times they feel the presence of the ring...drawn to the power of the one..they will never stop hunting you.
STRIDER, MERRY, PIPPIN, AND FRODO march through a gloomy, overgrown forest. Sam follows at the read leading "Bill", scrawny pony, who is laden with supplies.
Where are you taking us?
Into the wild. Frodo watches uneasily as Strider moves off into the cove the trees...
(whispered aside) How do, we know this Strider is a friend of Gandalf?
We have no choice but to trust him.
But where is he leading us?
Strider stops, casts a glance back at Sam.
To Rivendell, Master Gamgee...to the house of Elrond. SAM looks excited.
Did you hear that, Bill? Rivendell! We're going to see the Elves! Strider leads the Hobbits through the gloom of the forest
Aerial on: Strider leading Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin across the windswept moors. The hobbits suddenly stop and unstrap their knapsacks.
Gentlemen, we do not stop until nightfall.
What about breakfast?
You've already had it.
We've had one, yes...but what about Second Breakfast? Strider stares at Pippin blankly, then turns away, shakin his head.
I don't think he knows about second breakfast, Pip.
What about Elvenses, Luncheon, Afternoon Tea, dinner...he knows about them, doesn't he?
I wouldn't count on it. An apple is thrown to Merry, who deftly catches it.   Ano aimed at Pippin, catches him on the forehead.
(exasperated) Pippin! The hobbits trudge through rain, looking tired, hungry, a miserable.
Saruman stands over the Palantir, his hands cupping the massive eye.
(whisper) The power of Isengard is at your command, Sauron, Lord of the Earth.

head_text.subj: HARSH, GUTTURAL WORDS THE VOICE OF SARUMAN EMERGES.

text: Build me an army worth of Mordor.
Saruman is seated as his ORC OVERSEER approaches.
What orders from Mordor, my Lord. What does the eye command?
We have work to do.

CLOSE ON: GANDALF...lying unconscious on a cold obsidian floor. He wakes to the sound of ripping and tearing...ris onto his knees...lifting his head... Gandalf stands as th camera pulls back to reveal him stranded on the summit of Orthanc. He is marooned on the tiny, flat peak, surrounde on all sides by a sheer 500 FOOT DROP. Another whispering wail rends the air. Gandalf crosses quickly to the edge a peers down: POV: One of the beautiful Isengard trees is b ripped from the ground by the ORCS. Gandalf looks on in Horror as ORCS hack into the trunk with axes.
SARUMAN stands in Rain looking out into the dark night... ORC overseer sidles up to him, axe in hand, sweating with exertion.
The trees are strong, my Lord.   Their roots go deep.
Rip them all down. CAMERA CIRCLES SUMMIT: MORE AND MORE TREES are hauled dow and killed...as Gandalf looks on in helpless despair.
Wide on: The rugged countryside as the hobbits journey on lead by Strider. Strider stops before a distant hill, top by an Ancient Ruin.
This was once the great Watchtower of Amon Sul. We shall rest here tonight.
FRODO, MERRY, AND PIPPIN collapse into a small hollow, halfway up Weathertop...they are muddy and exhausted. Sti drops 4 small swords at the Hobbits feet.
There are for you. Keep them close. I'm going to have a look around. Stay here.
Close on: Frodo...eyes flickering open. He suddenly sits sniffing the air. Sam, Merry, and Pippin huddled over a s fire... Sausages and bacon sizzle in a hot frying pan.
What are you doing?
Tomatoes, sausages, and crispy bacon.
We saved some for you, Mr. Frodo.
Put it out, you fools! Put it out! Frodo desperately kicks dirt on the fire!
Oh, that's nice...ash on my tomatoes!
FIVE RINGWRAITHS ON FOOT, running up the steep slope unnaturally fast.
Go! ! Frodo, Sam, Merry and Pippin clamber desperately towards summit, clutching their swords.

Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin race into a RING OF BROKEN STONES on the summit or Weathertop...the ruined base of a ancient tower. The hobbits stand back-to-back in the cent of the Ring, waiting for the first assault... One by one, 5 Ringwraiths appear...brandishing Gleaming swords, they slowly towards the hobbits. In the center is their leader...the WITCH KING!

Back, you devils! Sam rushes forward with a cry. He swings his sword at the Witch King, who blocks the blow with his own sword. Sam's blade shatters...the WITCH KING lashes out with his fist, sending Sam flying. Merry and Pippin, overcome with terro throw themselves flat on the ground. THE RINGWRAITHS clos on Frodo...a Venomous whisper dances in his head... Frodo shuts his eyes and staggers back, desperately resis the WRAITH'S WHISPERINGS... slow motion as his hand goes his pocket and pulls out the ring. The 5 Ringwraiths utte chilling SCREECH OF EXCITEMENT. Frodo is unable to resist longer, falls to his knees and slips on the ring. He disappears.
No!

Frodo finds himself in the weird twilight world...he look upon the Ringwraiths, now visible in their TRUE APPEARANC Five Ghouls dressed in long Grey robes, with white hair, Pallid, ruthless faces. THE WITCH KING extends a haggard towards Frodo, reaching for the ring on his finger. Frodo trembling hand extends forward as if by the pull of the ring...he slides to the ground, unable to pull his hand a The witch king snarls and springs forward. He stabs at Fr with a wicked dagger! Frodo winces as the tip of the dagg sinks into his shoulder. Suddenly, Strider charges at the RINGWRAITHS, wielding his sword in one hand, a flaming to in the other. He moves in slow motion, visible through a of mist. Frodo sinks to the ground. Behind him is a faint image of a Ringwraith fleeing, his head engulfed in flame With draining strength, Frodo manages to pull the ring of his finger...
...Appearing back in the real world, Sam rushes over to h
(horrified) Frodo! Another Ringwraith is burning and screaming...others scre fearfully at the flames, turn and flee form the Weatherto summit.
(panicked) Mr. Frodo!! Strider kneels before Frodo. He snatches up the Witch Kin Dagger from the ground, staring gravely at the long, thin blade.
Help him, Strider!
(grim) He's been stabbed by a Morgul blade. The Morgul Blade suddenly melts...vanishing into the air like smoke. Strider throws the hilt down in disgust...
Do something.
This is beyond my skill to heal. (urgently) He needs Elvish medicine. Strider lifts Frodo onto his shoulders.
Strider is jogging grimly, carrying an ailing Frodo on hi back. Sam, Merry, and Pippin are running to keep up. The hobbits are carrying Flaming torches for protection.
Hurry!
We are six days from Rivendell. Frodo groans.
Hold on, Frodo.
He'll never make it! Close on: Frodo...head lolling about, barely conscious.
(fevered calling) Gandalf...Gandalf?

Low angle...looking up at ORTHANC...the tower of Isengard gleaming in the moonlight. The camera rises to reveal the once beautiful gardens are not a pitted wasteland...with smoke and fire billowing out of numerous tunnels and vent holes that litter the foreco of ORTHANC. Strange guttural chants echo up from deep underground. The camera is rising...a small moth flutters into shot...and leads the camera towards the summit or Orthanc. Gandalf lies slumped against the wall at the ver top of Orthanc, surrounded by a sheer 500 foot drop. He looks Weak and Frail...and is seemingly asleep. The MOTH flutters close to Gandalf. His hand suddenly moves at lighting speed and SNATCHES THE MOTH. Gandalf brings his close to his face and opens it. The moth sits on the palm his hand as Gandalf mutter strange words in a foreign ton Close on: THE MOTH'S face... seemingly listening.
It suddenly flutters away. CAMERA FOLLOWS the moth off th Orthanc summit, but drops past the moth...falling down, d towards the pitted wasteland, straight into a fiery red tunnel!

The dead trees of Isengard are fed into roaring furnaces...molten metal pours into casts...red hot metal, beaten my sweating orc blacksmiths...armor and weapons ar forged from the great furnaces. Saruman strides among the ORCS and stands looking on a new born uruk-hai as it esca its birthing membrane...this is LURTZ, who rises up to st before his master.
Close on: Frodo...his eyes flicker open...clouded, red- rimmed...his brow, beaded with sweat.
Is he going to die? Frodo's breathing is getting shallow. Strider looks out into the darkness.
No. He is passing into the shadow world, he will soon become a wraith like them. A DISTANT CRY of a RINGWRAITH carries through the air.
(nervous) They're close. Frodo gasps in sudden pain.
(thinking hard) Sam, do you know the Athelas plant? Sam looks blank.
Athelas?
Kingsfoil.
Kingsfoil.     Aye.    It's a weed.
It may help to slow the poison. Hurry!
Sam and Strider desperately search the dark forest floor the Athelas plant. Close on: A small, white flowered plan Strider drops to one knee, carefully pulling it from the ground.
What is this? A Ranger caught off his guard? Strider slowly looks up.

Frodo is breathing hard, desperately ill. Frodo's half- conscious POV: Surreal impression...a SHIMMERING FIGURE I WHITE leaps off a horse. FLASH INSERT: An ethereal vision of ARWEN, as she appears the other side...

(ELVISH: with sub titles) Frodo, Im Arwen...telin let thaed. I am Arwen, I have come here to help you. (urgent) Lasto Beth nin, tolo Dan na ngalad. Hear my voice, come back to the light. Frodo's eyes close.
Who is she?
(worried) Frodo?
She's an elf.
Who now appears in her earth bound form, a young Elven wo with tousled hair, dressed in mud-splattered riding cloth
He's fading...he's not gong to last. We must get him to my father. Strider quickly lifts Frodo...placing him on the horse.
I have been looking for you for two days.
Where are you taking him?
There are five Wraiths behind you, where the other four are, I do not know.
(ELVISH: with subtitles) Dartho guin Berian...rych le ad tolthathon. Stay with the hobbits...I'11 send horses for you. Close on: Arwen grabbing the Reins of the horse.
(ELVISH: w/subtitles) Hon mabathon. Rochoh ellint im. I'll take him. I'm the faster rider. Strider clamps his hand over Arwen's.
(elvish:subtitles) Andelu I ven. The road is too dangerous.
(Elvish: subtitles) Frodo Fir. Ae anthradon I hir, tur gwaith nin beriatha hon. If I can cross the river, the power of my people can protect him.
What are they saying? CLOSE ON: Arwen reaches for Strider's hand...looking deep into his eyes.
I do not fear them.
CLOSE ON: Strider...we see that it is hard for him to let go.
Arwen mounts her horse, ALSFORTH...
Arwen...ride hard, don't look back.
Arwen looks down at Strider as she supports Frodo with on hand.
(elvish) Noro Lim, Asfaloth, Noro Lim!
What are you doing!    Those Wraiths are still out there!
Asfaloth springs away, bearing Arwen and Frodo into the night.
SPEEDING POV: through the forest from the back of the Whi Horse.
he lifts his head weakly. SURREAL SLOW MOTION POV: THE HO HEAD BOBBING...trees sliding by...moonlight flickers thro the trees.
AERIAL: of Arwen's white horse emerging from the trees... galloping across the open land as the sun rises.

The white horse charges through a Pine Forest. Suddenly 2 Galloping Ringwraiths emerge from the trees behind! 2 mor Ringwraiths slide in from different directions to join th chase. Arwen grits her teeth...urges the white horse to greater speed.

The white horse speeds out of the pine trees...the 4 ringwraiths close behind PAN ONTO: 2 more ringwraiths galloping down the hillside! AERIAL SHOT: 3 MORE RINGWRAI enter frame from different directions...a total of 9 RINGWRAITHS now pursuing Frodo and Arwen! CLOSE ON: Panti head of the WHITE ELVEN HORSE.
Noro lim, Asfaloth!

CRANE DOWN: As the White Horse races towards Camera, to Reveal the wide river Bruinen in the foreground. Without hesitation, the white horse leaps into the shallo water and thunders across the Ford. The 9 Ringwraiths pul short of the Ford, clearly nervous of the water. The whit horse reaches the other side...Arwen pulls up and turns t defiantly face the Ringwraiths from across the Ford.
Give up the Halfling, she-elf! She draws her sword and yells at the Witch King.

(yelling) If you want him, come and claim him. THE WITCH KING SCREECHES ANGRILY, draws his sword, and le the Ringwraiths across the Ford. The water starts flowing faster...a distant rumble can be heard. Arwen waits until they are halfway across: she suddenly stands in the saddl arms raised!
(Elvish) Non o Chithaeglir, lasto Beth daer: Rimmo nin Briunen Dan in Ulaer!
Nin o Chitaeglir, lasto Beth daer: Rimmo nin Bruinen Dan in Ulaer!

head_text.subj: THE GROUND SUDDENLY TREMBLES...A MIGHTY ROAR FILLS THE AI

text: Frodo looks up weakly...to see a vast torrent of Water flooding down the river towards the ford...as if a dam ha burst! The Foaming water seems to form the shape of Danci white horses with frothing manes! The Ringwraiths scream terror as they are swallowed up in the deluge. Their Pier cries are drowned in the roaring of the river as it carri them away! CLOSE ON: FRODO as he loses consciousness...
(upset) No, no...Frodo, no!     Frodo, don't give in...not now! Arwen gathers the small Hobbit in her arms, feeling his l slip away.
What grace is given me, let it pass to him. Let him be spared. Save him. IMAGE: A BRIGHT LIGHT suddenly flares...Frodo squeezes hi eyes shut, gasping.
(frightened) Where am I? A FAMILIAR VOICE cuts through the swirl of sound.
You are in the House of Elrond, and it is ten o'clock in the morning on October the twenty-fourth, if you want to know.
Frodo's eyes flicker Open He is lying in bed next to an O Window...Dappled sunlight plays on richly carved timbers...the sound of a nearby waterfall drifts through Vista of Fir Trees.
(weak relief) Gandalf!
softly puffing on his pipe.    He smiles at Frodo.

Yes, I'm here and you're lucky to be here, too. A few more hours and you would have been beyond our aid. You have some strength in you, my dear Hobbit. Frodo sits up, looking at Gandalf questioningly...
What happened, Gandalf?    Why didn't you meet us?
I'm sorry Frodo. Close on: Gandalf... troubled.   His eyes drift away.
I was delayed.
SARUMAN stands over Gandalf, gloating...
Get up! So much for the power of the Ring or embrace your own destruction! With the power of his staff, Saruman raises Gandalf from ground, then sends him crashing to the floor.

There is only one Lord of the Ring. Only one who can bend it to his will...and he does not share power. SUDDENLY! GANDALF lurches to his feet and Throws himself the Tower! Saruman watches Gandalf fly away from Isengard...on the Back of a GIANT EAGLE.
(chilling) So you have chosen death!
Gwaihir the Eagle soars majestically over the mountains, carrying Gandalf towards the dawn.
Frodo raises himself up and looks at Gandalf.
Gandalf! What is it? Gandalf returns his attention to Frodo.
Nothing, Frodo... Sam runs to Frodo's bedside.   He is overjoyed to find Fr awake.
Frodo!   Frodo!   Bless you, you're awake!!
Sam has hardly left your side.
We were worried about you--weren't we, Mr. Gandalf?

By the skills of Lord Elrond, you're beginning to mend. ELROND, LORD OF THE HIGH ELVES, steps up to Frodo's bedside...his face is neither old nor young, though in it written the memory of many things both glad and sorrowful
Welcome to Rivendell, Frodo Baggins. Frodo sits up, looking at Elrond with awe.
WIDE ON: RIVENDELL... a small cluster of elegant Elven Buildings sitting in a Shangri-la like Valley below tower cliffs and snow capped mountains.

You have found your way to the last homely house east of the sea. The elves of Imladris have dwelt within this valley for three thousand years through few of my kin now remain. Frodo looks out from his balcony.
Frodo and Sam walk together. Suddenly, the voices of Merr and Pippin can be heard as they bound up to Frodo and thr their arms around him.
Frodo!   Frodo! Sam looks past Frodo smiling... a bent figure sits alone bench, in the Sun. Close on: Frodo turning, following Sam gaze...
Bilbo!
Close on: BILBO BAGGINS! He breaks in to a broad grin as Frodo rushes forward to embrace him. Bilbo has aged significantly since we last saw him.
Hello, Frodo, my lad!
Bilbo! LATER... Frodo is turning the neatly inscribed title page a red leather bound journal:

(reading) "There and back again: A Hobbit's tale" by Bilbo Baggins. Bilbo smiles Proudly. He is sitting with Frodo on a terra overlooking a Waterfall. Frodo looks at Page after page o beautiful Handwriting, with intricate Maps and Drawings.
This is wonderful.

I meant to go back...wander the paths of Mirkwood, visit Laketown, see the Lonely Mountain again...but age, it seems, has finally caught up with me. Frodo turns a page...there before him, is a map of the Sh

(quietly) I miss the Shire...I spent all my childhood pretending I was off somewhere else...off with you, on one of your adventures... (Looks at Bilbo) But my own adventure, turned out to be quite different...I'm not like you, Bilbo.
My dear boy...
Sam busily tries to stuff more and more things into his already full pack...pots and pans, blankets, cooking utensils, provisions, clothes.
No, what have I forgotten? Pull back to reveal Frodo, hands in his pocket, watching Sam.
Packed already? Sam looks up, startled.
(slightly embarrassed) No harm in being prepared. Frodo strolls to the edge of the Balcony.
I thought you wanted to see the Elves, Sam?
I do...
More than anything.
I did. It's just...we did what Gandalf wanted, didn't we? We got the Ring this far, to Rivendell...and I thought... seeing as how you're on the mend, we'd be off soon. Off home.
You're right, Sam. Frodo looks at Sam...
...we did what we set out to do. Frodo opens his hand, the Ring sits in his Palm.
The ring will be safe in Rivendell. I am ready to go home.
Gandalf and Elrond watch Frodo and Sam from Elrond's balc
His strength returns.
That wound will never fully heal. He will carry it the rest of his life.
And yet to have come so far still bearing the Ring...the hobbit has shown extraordinary resilience to its evil.
It is a burden he should never have to had to bear. We can ask no more of Frodo.
Gandalf, the enemy is moving. Sauron's forces are massing in the east. His eye is fixed on Rivendell. And Saruman, you tell me, has betrayed us. Our list of allies grows thin.

His treachery runs deeper than you know. By foul craft, Saruman has crossed Orc with Goblin Men...he is breeding an army in the caverns of Isengard. An army that can move in Sunlight and cover great distance at speed. Saruman is coming for the Ring. Elrond turns and walks away...

This evil cannot be concealed by the power of the Elves...We do not have the strength to fight both Mordor and Isengard...Gandalf...the ring cannot stay here. Gandalf turns and looks out the window. Sounds of arrivals...Gandalf watches as Boromir rides thr Rivendell gate, followed by Legolas and Gimli.
This peril belongs to all Middle earth. They must decide how to end it. Not just for themselves but for those who come after. Elrond approaches Gandalf.

The time of the Elves is over. My people are leaving these shores. Who will you look to when we have gone? The dwarves? They hide in their mountains seeking riches. They care nothing for the troubles of others.
It is in Men that we must place our hope.

Men? Men are weak.      The race of Men is failing. The blood     of Numenor is all but spent, its pride and    dignity forgotten. It is because of men    the Ring survives. FLASH INSERT: With the broken sword, Isildur slices off Sauron's finger. Elrond reacts.
I was there, Gandalf...I was there three thousand years ago when Isildur took the ring.
I was there the day the strength of Men failed.
Isildur...hurry...follow me! IMAGES: ELROND leads Isildur into the steaming volcano.
I let Isildur into the heart of Mount Doom, where the ring was forged: the one place it could be destroyed.
Cast it into the fire...destroy it! CLOSE ON: ISILDUR...CAPTIVATED BY THE RING.
No. Isildur turns and walks away
Isildur!!
Elrond turns to Gandalf.

It should have ended that day, but evil was allowed to endure. Isildur kept the Ring...and the line of Kings was broken. There's no strength left in the world of Men. They're scattered, divided, leaderless.
There is one who could unite them, one who could re claim the thrown of Gondor.
He turned from that path a long time ago. He has chosen exile.

Strider watches from the shadows...as Boromir strolls thr the darkened gallery. Boromir's eyes are drawn to an old Fresco on the wall...depicting Isildur defeating Sauron. Boromir looks with Wonderment at Narsil, the Broken Blade Elendil, which lies on a cloth-covered plinth.

(quiet awe) The shards of Narsil...the blade that cut the Ring from Sauron's hand. Boromir picks up the sword and gently touches the Blade. Close on: a small bloom of blood appears on Boromir's finger...
Still sharp. Boromir senses Strider's presence...he looks from the bla to Strider, as if sensing a connection.
But no more than a broken heirloom.
replaces the Broken blade, but it clatters to the floor. Boromir walks away, leaving Strider sitting alone. Close on: Strider picks up the broken hilt, as Arwen appe behind him.
Why do you fear the past? You are Isildur's heir...not Isildur himself. You are not bound to his fate.
The same blood flows in my veins...the same weakness...

Your time will come. You will face the same evil...and you will defeat it. (Elvish: w/subtitles) A si i-duath u-orthor, Aragorn...u or le a u or nin. The shadow does not hold sway yet...not over you and not over me.
Night falls upon the beautiful valley of Rivendell... sti and quiet.
Strider and Arwen stand upon a stone bridge...the Evensta Arwen's breast shines in the moonlight.
(Elvish: with subtitles) Renech I lu I erui govannem?   Do you remember when we first met?
(Elvish: with subtitles) Nauthannim I ned ol reniannen.   I thought I had strayed into a dream. Arwen reaches up and gently touches the Grey at Strider's temples.
(Elvish: with subtitles) Gwenin in enniath...u-arnech in naeth I se celich. Long years have passed...you did not have the care you carry now. Arwen looks into Strider's eyes.
(Elvish: with subtitles) Renech I Beth I pennen? Do you remember what I told you? Arwen reaches for Strider's hand...
(quietly) You said you'd bind yourself to me, forsaking the immortal life of your people.
(whisper) And to that I hold. I would rather share one lifetime with you than face all the ages of this world alone. Strider looks down. In his hand lies the Evenstar.
I choose a mortal live.
You cannot give me this.
It is mine to give to whom I will, like my heart. Arwen closes Strider's fingers around the jewel. Arwen leans towards Strider, gently kissing him.
Elrond addresses the council...

Strangers from distant lands ... friends of old. You have been summoned here to answer the threat of Mordor. Middle-earth stands upon the brink of destruction. None can escape it. You will unite...or you will fall. Each race is bound to this fate...this one doom... Frodo sits amongst a council of free-peoples of Middle ea Elrond stands before them, addressing Gandalf, Strider, Legolas, and 20 other elves, Dwarves, and men.
Bring forth the ring, Frodo. Frodo steps forward and moves towards a stone Plinth. He places the ring on the plinth and returns to his seat.
(shocked) So it is true!
(disbelief) Sauron's Ring! The ring of power!
(grim) The doom of man!

It is a gift...a gift to the foes of Mordor! Why not use this Ring? Long has my father, the Steward of Gondor, held the forces of Mordor at bay...by the blood of our people are your lands kept safe. Give Gondor the weapon of the enemy...let us use it against him!
You cannot wield it. None of us can. The one ring answers to Sauron alone...it has no other master. Boromir turns and looks at Strider, coolly.
And what would a ranger know of this matter? Strider says nothing and Boromir turns away dismissively. LEGOLAS stands...
This is no mere Ranger. He is Aragorn, son of Arathorn. You owe him your allegiance. Frodo looks at Strider questioningly...Boromir turns shar
(quiet disbelief) Aragorn? This is Isildur's heir?
And heir to the throne of Gondor.
(Elvish: with subtitles) Havo dad, Legolas...Sit down, Legolas..
Gondor needs no king.
Aragorn is right...we cannot use it.
You have only one choice..the ring must be destroyed.
The HUM OF THE RING seems to grow louder in Frodo's ears. Gimli suddenly stands, excited.

Then...what are we waiting for? Gimli suddenly rushes forward! He swings his axe down on ring. The axe shatters with a deafening crack! Gimli fall backwards, staring in disbelief at the ring...unharmed! F winces as an angry image of the fiery eye hits him! He sl in this chair, clutching his forehead. Gandalf looks at h with concern.
The ring cannot be destroyed, Gimli, son of Gloin, by any craft that we

here possess. The ring was made in the fires of Mount Doom...only there can it be unmade. It must be taken deep into Mordor, and cast back into the fiery chasm from whence it came. One of you must do this. Stunned silence...the council sits with downcast eyes, as a great dread has descended on them. Boromir addresses th council in a quiet voice

One does not simply walk into Mordor. Its black gates are guarded by more than just Orcs. There is evil there that does not sleep and the Great Eye is ever watchful. It is a barren wasteland, riddled with fire and ash and dust...the very air you breathe is a poisonous fume. Not with ten thousand men could you do this. It is folly.
Have you heard nothing Lord Elrond has said? The ring must be destroyed.
And I suppose you think you're the one to do it?
And if we fail, what then? What happens when Sauron takes back what is his? Gimli leaps to his feet!

I will be dead before I see the Ring in the hands of an Elf! A STORM OF ARGUMENT erupts around the room. CLOSE ON: FRODO...sound disappears as he watches in slow motion...the angry faces, the shaking fists, the accusato fingers, his eyes move across to the ring...the hum grows louder in his head.
(shouting) Never trust an Elf! CLOSE ON: THE RING fills the screen...streams of blood fl across the surface... flames flicker within the Gold Band

Do you not understand? While we    bicker among ourselves, Sauron's power   grows! No one will escape it. You will   all be destroyed, your homes burnt and   your families put to the sword! CLOSE ON: FRODO...breathing rapidly, Caught in the grip o his hideous vision. With a huge effort or will, Frodo tea his gaze upon the ring. Frodo suddenly stands...he speaks a strong, clear voice.
I will take it...I will take it...I will take the Ring to Mordor. Sudden silence...Frodo looks around the room at the astou faces.
(quietly) Though...I do not know the way. Gandalf rises to his feet.
I will help you bear this burden, Frodo Baggins, as long as it is yours to bear.
If, by my life or death, I can protect you, I will. (kneels before Frodo) ...you have my sword. Aragorn steps forward...followed by Legolas and Gimli.
And you have my bow.
And my axe. Boromir looks at them all then walks towards Frodo.
You carry the fate of us all, little one. Boromir looks towards Elrond and Gandalf.
If this is indeed the will of the Council, then Gondor will see it done. Frodo stares in wonder as the Greatest Fighters in all Mi earth stand at his side.
(unseen) Here! A Sudden Noise...Sam pops up from behind a Bush!
Mr. Frodo's not gong anywhere without me.
No, Indeed...it is hardly possible to separate you...even when he is summoned to a secret council and you are not. Merry and Pippin jump up from behind another bush!
Oi! We're coming too! You'll have to send us home tied up in a sack to stop us.
Anyway...you need people of intelligence on this sort of mission...quest...thing...
Well, that rules you out, Pip.
(thoughtfully) Nine companions ... so be it. (announcing) You shall be the "Fellowship of the ring"
Great.   Where are we going?
Close on: An old sword sliding out of a shabby leather Scabbard...its polished, well tendered Blade glitters col and bright.
My old sword "Sting"...here, take it! Bilbo offers Sting to Frodo.
It's so light!
Yes, yes, made by the Elves, you know. The blade glows blue when Orcs are close...and it's times like that, my lad, when you have to be extra careful. Bilbo unwraps a small shirt of close woven Mail.

Here's a pretty thing. Mithril, as light as a feather, and as hard as dragon scales. Let me see you put it on. Come on. CLOSE ON: Frodo peels off his shirt... revealing The Ring the Chain around his neck.
(entranced) Oh! My old Ring... Frodo frowns as Bilbo moves toward him.
I should very much like to hold it again, one last time. Bilbo reaches forward, eyes locked on the ring.

Suddenly! A shadow passes across Bilbo...for a split seco he becomes a wrinkled creature with a hungry face and Bon groping hands. Frodo pulls away, shocked...the shadow pas Bilbo slumps into a chair, his head in his hands. Bilbo falters...his eyes filling with tears.
Oh!
(sad) I'm sorry, that I brought this upon you, my boy...I'm sorry that you must carry this burden. I'm sorry for everything. Bilbo sobs and Frodo moves to comfort him.
The Fellowship climb the long steep path out of the clove vale of Rivendell.
The fellowship trekking through a land of Deep Valleys an turbulent waters...the misty mountains rise sharply to th left.
