We must hold to his course west of the misty Mountains for forty days. If our luck holds, the Gap of Rohan will still be open to us. From there, our road turns east, to Mordor.
CLOSE ON: Sam at the campfire. The sound of clashing swor Wider: Aragorn and Boromir are giving Pippin Sword tuitio
Get away from the blade, Pippin...on your toes...good, very good...I want you to react, not think.
Should not be too hard...
Move your feet.
Quite good, Pippin.
Thanks. CLOSE ON: GIMLI has managed to corner Gandalf....

If anyone were to ask for my opinion, which I note they have not, I would say we are taking the long way round. Gandalf, we can pass through the Mines of Moria. My cousin, Balin, would give us a royal welcome. Gandalf clearly thinks that is a bad idea.

No, Gimli. I would not take the road through Moria unless I had no other choice. Boromir thrusts, catching Pippin on the hand. Pippin thro down his sword, kicks and lunges at Boromir, tackling him the ground. Much laughter. Legolas' eyes are fixed on a distant Dark Patch which darts about the sky, like flying smoke in the wind.
What is that?
Nothing...it's just a wisp of a cloud.
(worried) It's moving fast...against the wind.
Crebain from Dunland!
(urgently) Hide!

Merry..Pippin...Sam...take cover! WIDE ON: THE FELLOWSHIP scramble under what little cover there is...as a regiment of Large crows fly low overhead Great speed, wheeling and circling above. As their dark shadow passes over the fellowship, a single harsh croak i heard...and the crows suddenly wheel away, back towards t south. Gandalf staggers to his feet.
(worried) Spies of Saruman.    The passage South is being watched. Gandalf looks at Aragorn, turns to the others...gesturing towards a high mountain pass.
We must take the pass of Caradhras!

The Fellowship clamber through Rock and Snow. CLOSE ON: F slips on some shale...as he scrambles to his feet, the Ri falls on the ground... CLOSE ON: the ring gleaming in the snow! Boromir's Hand picks it up by the chain...he stands the ring dangling before his eyes. He seems to grow in stature, as if absorbing its power. Aragorn warily approa Boromir...Boromir is motionless...he stares at the ring, if transfixed.
Boromir?
It is a strange fate that we should suffer so much fear and doubt over so small a thing...such a little thing.
(quietly) Boromir...give the ring to Frodo. ARAGORN'S HAND moves to his sword hilt.

Ring's POV...looking up at Boromir's face. The strange hu vibrates on the soundtrack. CLOSE ON: a Weird beatific sm lights up Boromir's face...The HUM grows to a Deafening r Boromir suddenly snaps out of his trance and hands the ri back to Frodo.
(lightly) As you wish. I care not. Boromir smiles at Frodo, ruffling his hair. CLOSE ON: ARA unhands his sword.

Following the crows as they race deeper and deeper, passi vista of Industry, Hundreds of Orcs and writhing Birthsacks...flying past Saruman, who stands upon a woode Gantry. CLOSE ON: Saruman, listening to the Cries of the crows.
So, Gandalf...you try to lead them over Caradhras. And if that fails...where then will you go? THE FELLOWSHIP struggles through the snow.
If the mountain defeats you, will you risk a more dangerous road?

THE FELLOWSHIP are struggling through a blinding blizzard towards the PASS OF CARADHRAS. Legolas the Elf moves ligh across the top of the snow...he suddenly pauses. Saruman' voice sweeps by in the wind.
(urgent) There is a fell voice in the air.
It's Saruman. THUNDER RUMBLES...ROCK and Shale fall from above.
(urgently) He's trying to bring down the mountain. Gandalf! We must turn back!
No! GANDALF RAISES HIS STAFF...HE CHANTS INTO THE WIND.
(YELLING)
Losto Caradhras, sedho, hodo, nuitho I ruith. Sleep Caradhras, be still, lie still, hold your wrath.
CAMERA SWEEPS PAST SARUMAN...he stands on the summit of Orthanc, Chanting. CLOUDS ARE FLOWING FROM ALL DIRECTIONS converging on the distant mountains in a stormy Malestrom

Saruman's voice strengthens...rolling past the fellowship like thunder. A LIGHTNING CRACK explodes on the mountains above them. Frodo looks up in horror as a huge snow avala thunders down towards them! The Fellowship throw themselv against the cliff face as snow crashes onto the narrow le LEGOLAS pulls Gandalf to safety. Aragorn shields Frodo an Sam as snow piles around them. Within moments, the pass i blocked and the fellowship are enveloped in snow. Boromir and Aragorn frantically dig for the hobbits...who are pul out Shivering and Fearful.
(urgent) We must get off the mountain! Make for the gap of Rohan and take the West road to my city.
The Gap of Rohan takes us too close to Isengard.
We cannot pass over the mountain. Let us go under it. Let us go through the mines of Moria. Gandalf has a concerned look on his face.
Moria. You fear to go into those mines, don't you? The dwarves delved too greedily and too deep.
You know what they awoke in, the darkness of Khazad-dum. Shadow and flame.
Let the ringbearer decide. CLOSE ON: FRODO, the weight of the decision weighing heav upon him. CLOSE ON: MERRY and PIPPIN shivering in Boromir arms.
Frodo? Frodo meets Gandalf's eye.
We will go through the mines. Gandalf slowly nods.
